UI_visible_response: A virtual private network (VPN) is a service that creates a safe, encrypted online connection, essentially extending a private network across a public network1. It establishes a secure connection between your computer and the internet by running your internet traffic through an encrypted tunnel to a remote server owned by a VPN provider5. A VPN, or virtual private network, masks your Internet protocol (IP) address, creating a private connection from a public wi-fi connection4. Through this encrypted virtual tunnel, all your data traffic is routed, ensuring privacy and security9.
traffic_visible_response: A virtual private network (VPN) is a service that creates a safe, encrypted online connection, essentially extending a private network across a public network [[1]]. It establishes a secure connection between your computer and the internet by running your internet traffic through an encrypted tunnel to a remote server owned by a VPN provider [[5]]. A VPN, or virtual private network, masks your Internet protocol (IP) address, creating a private connection from a public wi-fi connection [[4]]. Through this encrypted virtual tunnel, all your data traffic is routed, ensuring privacy and security [[9]].
